page.title: 20Contributors
page.content: The information in these pages was collected by pupils of Ellerslie School. This is an independant school of about 270 girls, aged from 11 to 18. Second year girls undertook the survey. The area covered was about 10 miles from the school and so the survey necessitated a day out and represents a concentrated effort for that time. The preparatory work was done by the geography teacher. The girls enjoyed taking part in the survey, although the area gave little scope for variety as it was entirely devoted to farming.
